name: Vaidyanath / Baidyanath
epithets: Ravana Anugrahit - Blessed by Ravana's Devotion
Kanwar Dham - Destination of Kanwar Pilgrimage

iconography.form_here: The Vaidyanath lingam is one of the largest Jyotirlingas, housed in a cramped but intensely sacred sanctum. The lingam is not perfectly shaped—tradition says it was damaged when Ravana dropped it. This 'imperfection' is part of its mystique.

symbolism.healing_aspect: Shiva as Vaidyanath represents cosmic medicine—the cure for samsara itself. Physical healing is the outer layer; spiritual liberation is the true healing offered here.
symbolism.ravana_connection: Even the demon king found grace through devotion. This teaches that sincere worship transcends the worshipper's nature.
symbolism.kanwar_tradition: Millions walking with Ganga water represents collective devotion—individual effort amplified by shared sacred purpose

mythology.origin_story: Ravana, the mighty demon king, was an extraordinary Shiva devotee. He performed intense tapas at this spot, and when his austerities injured his arms, Shiva personally healed him—becoming known as Vaidyanath, the Divine Physician. Pleased by Ravana's devotion, Shiva agreed to be taken to Lanka. But the gods, alarmed at Shiva leaving Bharat, tricked Ravana into setting down the lingam here—where it remains forever rooted.

key_episodes.title: Ravana's Supreme Devotion
key_episodes.story: Despite being a demon, Ravana was Shiva's greatest devotee. He composed the Shiva Tandava Stotram, lifted Mount Kailash, and performed unmatched austerities. At Vaidyanath, he cut off his heads as offerings until Shiva appeared.

key_episodes.title: The Lingam That Cannot Be Moved
key_episodes.story: When Ravana tried to carry the lingam to Lanka, Vishnu tricked him into setting it down. Since then, countless attempts to move the lingam have failed—it is rooted to the earth by divine will.

primary_mantra.translation: Salutations to the Lord of Physicians
primary_mantra.meaning: Invokes Shiva's healing aspect for physical and spiritual wellness

festivals.name: Shravan Mela / Kanwar Yatra
festivals.significance: 20 million+ Kanwariyas bring Ganga water from Sultanganj; world's largest annual pilgrimage

philosophy.core_teaching: Vaidyanath teaches that divine grace transcends human judgment. If Shiva could heal and bless Ravana, who are we to limit divine compassion? True devotion is recognized regardless of the devotee's worldly nature.
philosophy.healing_principle: The Lord is the ultimate physician—healing body, mind, and soul. Those who surrender completely receive healing at all levels.
